intro: Dendranthema sinuatum, commonly known as the English daisy, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its white petals with a yellow center and is native to Europe. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil. It blooms from late spring to early autumn, producing numerous small flower heads. Dendranthema sinuatum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also cultivated for cut flowers.
